articleContent.title: Arpeggio: sus4 in G# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: sus4 in G# (Shape: D)

## Description
The sus4 arpeggio in the key of G# (Shape: D) consists of the notes G# - C# - D# - G#. The sus4 chord is created by taking the 1st, 4th, and 5th notes of a major scale and played simultaneously or in a sequence. In this arpeggio, we have the root note G#, the perfect 4th note C#, the perfect 5th note D#, and another octave of the root note G#.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- C# (Perfect 4th)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Octave)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The sus4 arpeggio in G# (Shape: D) is often found in various genres of music such as rock, pop, jazz, and fusion. This arpeggio creates a sense of tension and resolution with its suspended 4th note, adding a unique and colorful flavor to the music. It can be used to create an ethereal and dreamy sound when played in sequences or as part of a chord progression.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the sus4 arpeggio in G# (Shape: D):
1. "Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin - The iconic intro of this classic rock song features a sus4 arpeggio played on guitar.
2. "Don't Speak" by No Doubt - The guitar riff in this pop-rock ballad includes the sus4 arpeggio in G#.
3. "Europa (Earth's Cry Heaven's Smile)" by Santana - This instrumental piece by Santana showcases the sus4 arpeggio in a fusion/jazz context, adding depth and emotion to the music.
